verses.verse: They gather together against the life of the righteous, And condemn ((Ex. 23:7); Ps. 106:38; (Prov. 17:15); Matt. 27:4) innocent blood.
But the LORD has been my defense, And my God the rock of my refuge.
He has brought on them their own iniquity, And shall cut them off in their own wickedness; The LORD our God shall cut them off.
(A Call to Worship and Obedience) Oh come, let us sing to the LORD! Let us shout joyfully to the Rock of our salvation.
Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving; Let us shout joyfully to Him with (Eph. 5:19; James 5:13) psalms.
For ((Ps. 96:4; 1 Cor. 8:5, 6)) the LORD is the great God, And the great King above all gods.
In His hand are the deep places of the earth; The heights of the hills are His also.
(Gen. 1:9, 10; Jon. 1:9) The sea is His, for He made it; And His hands formed the dry land.
Oh come, let us worship and bow down; Let (2 Chr. 6:13; Dan. 6:10; (Phil. 2:10)) us kneel before the LORD our Maker.
For He is our God, And (Ps. 79:13) we are the people of His pasture, And the sheep of His hand. (Heb. 3:7-11, 15; 4:7) Today, if you will hear His voice:
“Do not harden your hearts, as in the rebellion, (Ex. 17:2-7; Num. 20:13) As in the day of trial in the wilderness,
When (Ps. 78:18; (1 Cor. 10:9)) your fathers tested Me; They tried Me, though they (Num. 14:22) saw My work.
(Acts 7:36; 13:18; Heb. 3:10, 17) For forty years I was grieved with that generation, And said, ‘It is a people who go astray in their hearts, And they do not know My ways.’
